pros: Working there made me feel like I was really making a difference each day. Goals were customer service based, and managers gave great feedback, whether positive or negative.
cons: The patient population isn't always the nicest, (sometimes due to hardship).

job_title: Behavioral Health Provider in Thornton, CO
pros: I absolutely love getting to serve this patient population and learn new things every single day, I feel as if this role has really helped me develop my clinical skills and seek on my feet.
cons: This is a very difficult position to maintain, be ready to experience burn out in the first few months of working here, be on call every hour you were working, and not have a lot of flexibility in scheduling or managing your own schedule.

job_title: Assistant Nursing Director in Boulder, CO

cons: Too siloed, chiefs/VP’s have no idea what is going on at the sites.

pros: If you are mission driven and want to care for the underserved and marginalized communities, this is for you.
cons: Demanding job, you must strive for work/life balance.

pros: Great network of people who genuinely care about those the community they support.
cons: Disorganization, lack of efficient communication, and low pay.

pros:
Warm atmosphere with caring people
A mission that makes you feel like your work is meaningful - I go home at night feeling satisfied, even on rough or stressful days.
Supervisors who care about you as a human being.
Good benefits - PTO, work schedule, holidays, health insurance, CME allowance
Competitive Pay
Hire New Grad nurses (this was my first job out of nursing school.)
cons:
Can be stressful - many demands at once can require good prioritization skills.
Patients in difficult situations - difficult for patients to be "compliant" at times due to many barriers to care.  This can lead to burn-out for staff at times.
Difficult patient interactions (especially related to mental health concerns)
Growing organization, which is great for access but can feel chaotic.  
High staff turnover, which we are working to reduce.

pros: The only reason I gave them 1 star is because they have a great system for finding documents and HR is well organized. From what I heard not all sites are as bad as this one so if you get hired at a different site hopefully it is better.
cons: Cliques, insurance is terrible, ask for way more than they should, you can feel the divide between people who have worked here for years and new people, no support from management. There is no uniform protocol for anything, and the ones who are "supervising" or coaching on them don't even know them so they change on a regular. People do as they please here, leaving early or coming in late without warning. When they do let management know they are so unorganized they approve things for those they like without thinking if it will hurt them in the long run.

review_title: Great Experience just burned out quickly
pros: Ongoing education, collaborative care, great experience, connection and relationship with patients, free health and dental insurance, employer contribution to 401k after 1 year, average pay for the job, challenging, opportunity for managerial advancement sometimes, great culture and values,
cons: turn over is high, high stress job, support was lacking, too many responsibilities and expectations for case managers, pay is a bit low for the intensity of the job, at times i saw 20+ patients a day and the providers would ask case managers to see patients when not necessary, strict hours, not a lot of flexibility if you don't have vacation hours banked. work -life balance for me was horrible.

job_title: Satisfied Team Member in Denver, CO
pros: Clinica has proven for years that if you lead with the heart and the mind, everything else will follow.  Its people are its greatest resource and we are treated as such.  This organization truly takes the time to hire the right individual for the particular role and seems to have it down to a science.  As much as we care about our patients, our staff is equally valued.  It feels so rewarding to have left the corporate mentality in my rearview!
cons: Is it possible to care too much?  With so many like-minded, mission-oriented team members across the org, there are times when the mission becomes difficult to sustain, particularly from a financial perspective.  We always seem to find a way, however.

pros: When I started at Clinica I was nervous because I had never worked in the health industry. I quickly learned about medical terms and how to handle situations because of how great the staff is. Everyone is kind and helpful and welcoming. I can say I'm genuinely  happy and challenged in this organization. Everything changes quickly and so it's a great place to work at if you like being presented with different  projects and goals to reach.
cons:
Training for Office Technician needs more structure

Not all roles are fully aware of each others roles and what they entail and bring forward to making the organization a functional one.

pros:
Great place to work!  Positive sense of mission, serving others to provide affordable healthcare for those who are less likely to have options to receive it.
Great people, sense of community among co-workers.
Great options to contribute creatively.  
Internationally recognized leader in integrated health care model
cons:
Compassion Fatigue
Sometimes, due to the fast pace and our mission to serve, we forget to recognize people's accomplishments or take the time to truly recognize those who serve diligently and go above and beyond.

pros: I feel very supported working at Clinica. The interpersonal relationships I have with my coworkers are amazingly strong and have fostered my growth as a nurse. I couldn't imagine working anywhere else, and I plan on going back to school to become a NP at Clinica.
cons: This job can get stressful at times, but I've never encountered a nursing job that doesn't get stressful. I do feel less stressed here at Clinica than I would in the Hospital.

pros: Great benefits, amazing co-workers, ample opportunity for advancement, supportive environment, get to be a part of the community & help people, hands on executive team, competitive pay, personal health initiatives & contests...
cons: Can't think of anything that stands out from any other job, sure I'd rather be on a beach or hiking everyday and not have to go to work but I'm glad I get to come here and plan to stay as long as they will keep me.

review_title: Great Place to Work and for Growth and Development
job_title: Office Technician Supervisor in Boulder, CO
pros: Clinica does an awesome work for people in the community offering high quality of care and caring about them as well as us, employees. I love the diversity of our team, the opportunity for growth and development in my career, and to contribute to Clinica's Mission. I would recommend anyone looking for a job in Healthcare to give Clinica a try.
cons: It is a little far away from my home.

pros:
Highly repetitive, few surprises, in comparison to a skilled nursing facility or ED setting for example.  Even if an unexpected event were to happen, a primary care provider along with their lead is always a door knock away. 
Suffice amount of patient-focused PCPs, RNs, MAs and Case Management.
Each nurse has their own desk. Medical assistants and PCPs receive the bulk of direct patient contact leaving the RN with phone triage, answering emails and random pages/labs etc,. Typical desk work.
Freedom of expression! Not mandated to wear uniforms or scrubs. Even when working 12 hour shifts, most nurses wear business casual, complete with stylish, cute boots, or closed-toed sandals (weather-permitting) and even jewelry. No sneakers or ugly clogs needed as this position is heavily (85-90%) sedentary.
Internal medicine perks in the form of potlucks, an hour lunch, plenty of time to socialize and build friendships with your co-workers. Lots of food. Always!
Great RN pay for basic LPN duties, minus the phone triage.
 Okay to fair benefits, has been better in years past.
cons:
Redundant duties. Minimal to no med passing. Occasionally a PCP will order a stat fever reducer, DM teaching or anticoagulant therapy. Seasoned nurses with experience outside of IM may find this difficult as most nurses are Type A, driven individuals. Some nurses moonlight in home health care to maintain upkeep, however these nurses will self admit to burn out.
Triage nursing is a great option for older, and respectfully, unmotivated individuals. Even a promotion to Assistant or Director of Nursing will have even less direct patient care. Again, this is perfect for older, close to retiring nurses as your nursing theory and assessment skills will diminish thus limiting your hiring potential outside of IM.
Said redundancy leads to a high incidence of lateral bullying, ostracizing co workers, including new and newly hired RNs to the point of a very high turnover. Bullying to the point of firing, or an inability to retain, extremely bright and promising talent hidden as new grads.
I agree with the testimony below of not encouraging New Grads (RNs or MAs) to apply. The subpar NTMs eat their young, as the adage goes. 
I disagree with the testimony below stating  business hours as a Pro. All sites are open on designated days the week from 7am to 7pm. All nurses are expected to pull one to three 12-hour shifts per week.

pros: Very flexible managers with schedules, leaving early for emergencies or coming in a little late. Providers are mission-driven. Great place to meet new friends!
cons: Medical assistants speak sub-par English, middle school grammar. Sometimes you move up and sometimes you stay put. There will always be some sort of gossip/drama wherever you go.

job_title: Call Center Representative in Denver, CO
pros: This is a Monday- Friday 8am-5pm which is great.
cons: They really don't care about your life outside of work. They will write you up for missing work even if you have documentation..

pros: It has been an amazing experience working at Clinica FH, the whole staff is really professional and truly care about each other in the community. I am proud to be part of it.
cons: I have to say that it has been a good career opportunity with almost zero downsides.

pros: cross training in every department, first day at work is orientation to learn about the organization and their mission.
cons: No Cons.  Clinica is a great place to work.

pros: Nice facility.  Great break room for staff.
cons: Training not really good,  they throw you into the mix and expect you to know everything after a few days.  They get mad at you if you make a mistake on something that you weren't even trained on.

pros: Good work balance, good work environment and awesome mission.
cons: Little pay, unclear work assignments

pros: Great team, and atmosphere. Flexible hours and very nice people
cons: Difficult to move up within the company
